thread.title: High school football: Alta blows by Corner Canyon 45-31
thread.title_full: High school football: Alta blows by Corner Canyon 45-31 | Deseret News

author: Brandon Gurney
title: High school football: Alta blows by Corner Canyon 45-31
text:
The Hawks landed punches early and often against the visiting Chargers in the first game of what promises to be a very competitive rivalry.
Scoreboard » Corner Canyon Alta 31 45 See more stats » More Coverage All you need to know: High school football roundup for Friday, Oct. 23 High school football: Bobcats win battle of Cache Valley unbeatens in defensive slugfest, 5-0 High school football: State tournament pairings High school football: Pleasant Grove finishes thrilling comeback win “ We came out fired up. We were ready to play. We made some mistakes, but we made up for it and came away with a victory.”
Alta quarterback Braxton Kerr
SANDY — Alta threw punches early and often against rival Corner Canyon on Friday, en route to a 45-31 win where just about every punch thrown landed with a lot of force behind it.
Quarterback Braxton Kerr led the way for the Hawks, throwing five touchdown passes while directing an offense that seemingly moved at will throughout the context.
Kerr's first pass of the evening set the tone.
On the first play from scrimmage, Kerr hit a streaking Camden Johnson for an 84-yard touchdown pass to put Alta up 7-0 before Corner Canyon even knew what hit it.
“We knew exactly what they were doing and we had the right game plan,” said Alta coach Alema Te'o. “That very first play — we called it. We told everybody we were going to score on the first play, and that’s exactly what happened.”
Just over a minute later, Kerr and the Hawks struck again.
This time it was running back Joshua Davis catching a pass out of the backfield from 17 yards out to put the Hawks up 14-0 with 10:31 remaining in the first quarter.
“We came out fired up. We were ready to play,” Kerr said. “We made some mistakes, but we made up for it and came away with a victory.”
The Chargers managed to gather themselves and return some punches to put the game at 31-24 at the half before the Hawks again exploded out of the gate to start the second half.
Again it was Kerr connecting on a well-placed screen out of the backfield, this time to Zach Engstrom from 25 yards out to put the Hawks ahead 38-24 with 10:34 remaining in the third quarter.
From there, Alta buckled down on defense, allowing just one touchdown for the remainder to come away with the win.
For Alta players going against a team that included former teammates and friends, Friday's victory held a lot of meaning.
“It’s huge. It’s a big rivalry between the two schools and hopefully it’s the beginning of a great rivalry,” Te’o said. “My hat’s off to them, they have a great team.”
Te'o also wanted to convey a message to those wanting to come to Alta's home turf in the future.
“We don’t lose at home, and that’s the message we’re going to send to anyone who comes out here to play us,” Te’o said.
With the win, Alta finishes the season 7-3 and secures the No. 3 seed out of Region 7. With the loss, Corner Canyon secures the No. 4 seed while finishing the regular season with a 3-6 mark.
